title: Kara Tointon enjoys a low-key stroll with fiancé Marius Jensen and their son Frey
text:
She welcomed her first child in November last year.

And Kara Tointon was every inch the low-key mum on Tuesday as she enjoyed a stroll with her fiancé Marius Jensen, 36, and their son Frey, 11 months.

The actress, 36, cut a relaxed figure in a leather jacket with a sheepskin lining as she pushed her son along in the pram during the outing in West London.

Out and about: Kara Tointon was every inch the low-key mum on Tuesday as she enjoyed a stroll with her fiancé Marius Jensen, 36, and their son Frey, 11 months

Kara opted for a low-key ensemble as she teamed the black leather jacket with blue boyfriend jeans for the walk through the capital.

The former EastEnders star shielded her eyes with cat-eye sunglasses as she pushed little Frey along in a pram.

Kara was also joined by her Norwegian fiancé Marius, who cut an equally casual figure during the outing.

Out and about: The former EastEnders star cut a casual figure in a leather sheepskin jacket as she headed out in West London

Kara and Marius welcomed son Frey together in November last year, after first being spotted together a year earlier.

The couple spoke about the birth of their son in an interview with Hello! as they described the dramatic moment Kara was rushed into theatre for an emergency Caesarean section after their baby's heartbeat dropped.

She explained: 'Like everything in life, what you expect to happen, more often than not, doesn't. It did become quite dramatic and a bit frightening. I was in an episode of ER at that point. It all happened incredibly quickly.

'There is a nine-month build and then you meet your baby and instantly they are engraved in your mind. Suddenly you know them deeper than anyone while having only just met.'

Proud family: Kara gave birth to son Frey in November last year, after undergoing an emergency Caesarean section (the tot pictured above with Marius in August)

Kara announced she was expecting her first child in an interview with Hello! and described finding out she was pregnant as a 'life-changing' moment.

'It is the biggest life-changing moment when you have this little human being coming into your life that you are yet to meet,' she said.

'For me it was always about meeting the person that you know is the one you want to share this experience with.

'Marius and I said: ‘If it happens, we are ready, but we won’t plan. And then it happened quite quickly.'
description: The actress, 36, cut a relaxed figure in a leather jacket with a sheepskin lining as she pushed her son, 11 months, along in the pram during the outing with Marius, 36, in West London.
